alert.note: Alert for Northwest Plateau (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LasVegas (Southern Nevada, Southeastern California, Northwestern Arizona)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued December 29 at 3:21AM MST until December 31 at 5:00PM MST by NWS LasVegas
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM PST /11 AM MST/ THIS MORNING TO 4 PM PST /5 PM MST/ FRIDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations as high as 12 to 24 inches in the Spring Mountains, Sheep Range, and the mountains of southeast Lincoln County and northern Mohave County. * WHERE...Lincoln County, Sheep Range, Spring Mountains-Red Rock Canyon and Northwest Plateau. * WHEN...From 10 AM Wednesday to 4 PM PST Friday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult, especially on Highway 160 across Mountain Spring Summit. Also, Highway 156, 157 and 158 into Kyle and Lee Canyons. Higher elevations of Red Rock Loop may also be impacted. All highways throughout Lincoln County and Highway 389 and Mount Trumbull Loop in northern Mohave County.
info.instruction: A Winter Storm Warning for snow means severe winter weather conditions will make travel very hazardous or impossible. If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
